010package imagingbook.common.ij;
011
012import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
013import java.net.URI;
014import java.util.ArrayList;
015import java.util.Arrays;
016import java.util.Comparator;
017import java.util.LinkedList;
018import java.util.List;
019import java.util.Objects;
020
021import ij.ImagePlus;
022import ij.WindowManager;
023import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
024import ij.io.OpenDialog;
025import ij.io.Opener;
026import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
027import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
028import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilterRunner;
029import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
030import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
031import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
032import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
033import ij.process.ShortProcessor;
034import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
035import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
036import imagingbook.common.util.bits.BitMap;
037
038
039/**
040 * This class defines static utility methods adding to ImageJs functionality.
041 * @author WB
042 *
043 */
044public abstract class IjUtils {
045        
046        /**
047         * Returns a (possibly empty) array of ImagePlus objects that are
048         * sorted by their titles if the 'sortByTitle' flag is set.
049         * 
050         * @param sortByTitle flag, result is sorted if true.
051         * @return an array of currently open images.
052         */
053        public static ImagePlus[] getOpenImages(boolean sortByTitle) {
054                return getOpenImages(sortByTitle, null);
055        }
056        
057
058        /**
059         * Returns an array of strings containing the short titles
060         * of the images supplied.
061         * 
062         * @param images array of images.
063         * @return array of names.
064         */
065        public static String[] getImageShortTitles(ImagePlus[] images) {
066                String[] imageNames = new String[images.length];
067                for (int i = 0; i < images.length; i++) {
068                        imageNames[i] = images[i].getShortTitle();
069                }
070                return imageNames;
071        }
072        
073        /**
074         * Opens a dialog to let the user select one of the currently open images.
075         * @param title string to show in the dialog
076         * @return An ImagePlus object, use the getProcessor method to obtain the associated ImageProcessor
077         */
078        public static ImagePlus selectOpenImage(String title) {
079                ImagePlus[] openImages = getOpenImages(true, null);
080                String[] imageNames = getImageShortTitles(openImages);
081                if (title == null) {
082                        title = "image:";
083                }
084                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog("Select image");
085                gd.addChoice(title, imageNames, imageNames[0]);
086                gd.showDialog(); 
087                if (gd.wasCanceled()) 
088                        return null;
089                else {
090                        return openImages[gd.getNextChoiceIndex()];
091                }
092        }
093        
094        
095        /**
096         * Returns a (possibly empty) array of {@link ImagePlus} objects that are
097         * sorted by their titles if the sortByTitle flag is set.
098         * The image "exclude" (typically the current image) is not included 
099         * in the returned array (pass null to exclude no image).
100         * 
101         * @param sortByTitle set {@code true} to return images sorted by title
102         * @param exclude reference to an image to be excluded (may be {@code null})
103         * @return a (possibly empty) array of {@link ImagePlus} objects
104         */
105        public static ImagePlus[] getOpenImages(boolean sortByTitle, ImagePlus exclude) {
106                List<ImagePlus> imgList = new LinkedList<ImagePlus>();
107                int[] wList = WindowManager.getIDList();
108        if (wList != null) {
109                for (int i : wList) {
110                    ImagePlus imp = WindowManager.getImage(i);
111                    if (imp != null && imp != exclude) {
112                        imgList.add(imp);
113                    }
114                }
115        }
116        ImagePlus[] impArr = imgList.toArray(new ImagePlus[0]);
117        if (sortByTitle) {
118                Comparator<ImagePlus> cmp = new Comparator<ImagePlus>() {
119                        public int compare(ImagePlus impA, ImagePlus impB) {
120                                return impA.getTitle().compareTo(impB.getTitle());
121                        }
122                };
123                Arrays.sort(impArr, cmp);
124        }
125                return impArr;
126        }
127        
128
129        /**
130         *  Queries the user for an arbitrary file to be opened.
131         *  
132         * @param title string to be shown in the interaction window.
133         * @return path of the selected resource.
134         */
135        public static String askForOpenPath(String title) {
136                OpenDialog od = new OpenDialog(title, "");
137                String dir = od.getDirectory();
138                String name = od.getFileName();
139                if (name == null)
140                        return null;
141                return encodeURL(dir + name);
142        }
143        
144        private static String encodeURL(String url) {
145                //url = url.replaceAll(" ","%20");      // this doesn't work with spaces
146                url = url.replace('\\','/');
147                return url;
148        }
149        
150        //----------------------------------------------------------------------
151        
152
153        /**
154         * Creates an ImageJ {@link ImagePlus} image for the matrix {@code M[r][c]} (2D array),
155         * where {@code r} is treated as the row (vertical) coordinate and
156         * {@code c} is treated as the column (horizontal) coordinate.
157         * Use {@code show()} to display the resulting image.
158         * 
159         * @param title image title
160         * @param M 2D array
161         * @return a new {@link ImagePlus} image
162         */
163        public static ImagePlus createImage(String title, float[][] M) {
164                FloatProcessor fp = new FloatProcessor(M[0].length, M.length);
165                for (int u = 0; u < M[0].length; u++) {
166                        for (int v = 0; v < M.length; v++) {
167                                fp.setf(u, v, M[v][u]);
168                        }
169                }
170                return new ImagePlus(title, fp);
171        }
172        
173
174        /**
175         * Creates an ImageJ {@link ImagePlus} image for the matrix {@code M[r][c]} (2D array),
176         * where {@code r} is treated as the row (vertical) coordinate and
177         * {@code c} is treated as the column (horizontal) coordinate.
178         * Use {@code show()} to display the resulting image.
179         * 
180         * @param title the image title
181         * @param M a 2D array holding the image data
182         * @return a new {@link ImagePlus} instance
183         */
184        public static ImagePlus createImage(String title, double[][] M) {
185                FloatProcessor fp = new FloatProcessor(M[0].length, M.length);
186                for (int u = 0; u < M[0].length; u++) {
187                        for (int v = 0; v < M.length; v++) {
188                                fp.setf(u, v, (float) M[v][u]);
189                        }
190                }
191                return new ImagePlus(title, fp);
192        }
193        
194        /**
195         * Sets the weighing factors for the color components used
196         * in RGB-to-grayscale conversion for the specified image {@code ip}.
197         * Note that this method can be applied to any {@link ImageProcessor}
198         * instance but has no effect unless {@code ip} is of type
199         * {@link ColorProcessor}. Applies standard (ITU-709) weights.
200         * 
201         * @param ip The affected image
202         */
203        public static void setRgbConversionWeights(ImageProcessor ip) {
204                setRgbConversionWeights(ip, 0.299, 0.587, 0.114);
205        }
206        
207        /**
208         * Sets the weighing factors for the color components used
209         * in RGB-to-grayscale conversion for the specified image {@code ip}.
210         * Note that this method can be applied to any {@link ImageProcessor}
211         * instance but has no effect unless {@code ip} is of type
212         * {@link ColorProcessor}.
213         * 
214         * @param ip The affected image
215         * @param wr Red weight
216         * @param wg Green weight
217         * @param wb Blue weight
218         */
219        public static void setRgbConversionWeights(ImageProcessor ip, double wr, double wg, double wb) {
220                if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor) {
221                        ((ColorProcessor) ip).setRGBWeights(wr, wg, wb);
222                }
223        }
224        
225        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
226        
227        /** 
228         * Returns a copy of the pixel data as a 2D double
229         * array with dimensions [x = 0..width-1][y = 0..height-1].
230         * @param fp the image
231         * @return the resulting array
232         */
233        public static double[][] toDoubleArray(FloatProcessor fp) {
234                final int width = fp.getWidth();
235                final int height = fp.getHeight();
236                float[] fPixels = (float[]) fp.getPixels();
237                double[][] dPixels = new double[width][height];
238                int i = 0;
239                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
240                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
241                                dPixels[u][v] = fPixels[i];
242                                i++;
243                        }
244                }
245                return dPixels;
246        }
247        
248        /**
249         * Creates a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance of size width x height
250         * from the given 2D array with dimensions [x = 0..width-1][y = 0..height-1].
251         * 
252         * @param A a 2D {@code double} array
253         * @return a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance
254         */
255        public static FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor(double[][] A) {
256                final int width = A.length;
257                final int height = A[0].length;
258                float[] fPixels = new float[width * height];
259                int i = 0;
260                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
261                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
262                                fPixels[i] = (float) A[u][v];
263                                i++;
264                        }
265                }
266                return new FloatProcessor(width, height, fPixels);
267        }
268        
269        public static FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor(float[][] A) {
270                final int width = A.length;
271                final int height = A[0].length;
272                float[] fPixels = new float[width * height];
273                int i = 0;
274                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
275                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
276                                fPixels[i] = A[u][v];
277                                i++;
278                        }
279                }
280                return new FloatProcessor(width, height, fPixels);
281        }
282        
283        public static float[][] toFloatArray(FloatProcessor fp) {
284                final int w = fp.getWidth();
285                final int h = fp.getHeight();
286                float[][] A = new float[w][h];
287                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
288                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
289                                A[u][v] =  fp.getf(u, v);
290                        }
291                }
292                return A;
293        }
294        
295        /**
296         * Creates and returns a new {@code ByteProcessor} from
297         * the specified 2D {@code byte} array, assumed to be
298         * arranged in the form {@code A[x][y]}, i.e.,
299         * the first coordinate is horizontal, the second vertical.
300         * Thus {@code A.length} is the width and {@code A[0].length}
301         * the height of the resulting image.
302         * 
303         * @param A a 2D {@code byte} array
304         * @return a new {@code ByteProcessor} of size {@code A.length} x {@code A[0].length}
305         */
306        public static ByteProcessor toByteProcessor(byte[][] A) {
307                final int w = A.length;
308                final int h = A[0].length;
309                ByteProcessor bp = new ByteProcessor(w, h);
310                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
311                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
312                                bp.putPixel(u, v, 0xFF & A[u][v]);
313                        }
314                }
315                return bp;
316        }
317        
318        public static byte[][] toByteArray(ByteProcessor bp) {
319                final int w = bp.getWidth();
320                final int h = bp.getHeight();
321                byte[][] A = new byte[w][h];
322                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
323                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
324                                A[u][v] =  (byte) (0xFF & bp.get(u, v));
325                        }
326                }
327                return A;
328        }
329        
330        public static ByteProcessor toByteProcessor(int[][] A) {
331                final int w = A.length;
332                final int h = A[0].length;
333                ByteProcessor bp = new ByteProcessor(w, h);
334                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
335                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
336                                int val = A[u][v];
337                                if (val < 0)
338                                        val = 0;
339                                else if (val > 255) 
340                                        val = 255;
341                                bp.putPixel(u, v, val);
342                        }
343                }
344                return bp;
345        }
346        
347        /**
348         * Opens the image from the specified {@link URI} and returns it
349         * as a {@link ImagePlus} instance.
350         * 
351         * @param uri the URI leading to the image (including extension)
352         * @return A new {@link ImagePlus} instance or {@code null} if not found
353         */
354        public static ImagePlus openImage(URI uri) {
355                Objects.requireNonNull(uri);
356                return new Opener().openImage(uri.toString());
357        }
358        
359        
360        // Methods for checking/comparing images (primarily used for testing)  ---------------------
361        
362        /**
363         * Checks if two images are of the same type.
364         * 
365         * @param ip1 the first image
366         * @param ip2 the second image
367         * @return true if both images have the same type
368         */
369        public static boolean sameType(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2) {
370                return ip1.getClass().equals(ip2.getClass());
371        }
372        
373        /**
374         * Checks if two images have the same size.
375         * 
376         * @param ip1 the first image
377         * @param ip2 the second image
378         * @return true if both images have the same size
379         */
380        public static boolean sameSize(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2) {
381                return ip1.getWidth() == ip2.getWidth() && ip1.getHeight() == ip2.getHeight();
382        }
383        
384        /**
385         * Checks if the given image is possibly a binary image. This requires that
386         * the image contains at most two different pixel values, one of which
387         * must be zero. All pixels are checked.
388         * This should work for all image types.
389         * More efficient implementations are certainly possible.
390         * 
391         * @param ip the image ({@link ImageProcessor}) to be checked
392         * @return true if the image is binary
393         */
394        public static boolean isBinary(ImageProcessor ip) {
395                final int width = ip.getWidth();
396                final int height = ip.getHeight();
397                int fgVal = 0;
398                boolean binary = true;
399                
400                outer:
401                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
402                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
403                                int val = 0x007FFFFF & ip.get(u, v); // = mantissa in case of float
404                                if (val != 0) {
405                                        if (fgVal == 0) {       // first non-zero value
406                                                fgVal = val;
407                                        }
408                                        else if (val != fgVal) {        // found another non-zero value
409                                                binary = false;
410                                                break outer;
411                                        }
412                                }
413                        }
414                }
415                
416                return binary;
417        }
418        
419        /**
420         * Checks if the given image is "flat", i.e., all pixels have
421         * the same value.
422         * This should work for all image types.
423         * 
424         * @param ip the image ({@link ImageProcessor}) to be checked
425         * @return true if the image is flat
426         */
427        public static boolean isFlat(ImageProcessor ip) {
428                final int width = ip.getWidth();
429                final int height = ip.getHeight();
430                boolean flat = true;
431                int fgVal = ip.get(0, 0);
432                
433                outer:
434                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
435                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
436                                int val = ip.get(u, v);
437                                if (val != fgVal) {
438                                        flat = false;
439                                        break outer;
440                                }
441                        }
442                }
443                
444                return flat;
445        }
446        
447        /**
448         * Collects all image coordinates with non-zero pixel values into an array
449         * of 2D points ({@link Pnt2d}).
450         * 
451         * @param ip an image (of any type)
452         * @return an array of 2D points
453         */
454        public static Pnt2d[] collectNonzeroPoints(ImageProcessor ip) {
455                List<Pnt2d> points = new ArrayList<>();
456                int M = ip.getWidth();
457                int N = ip.getHeight();
458                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
459                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
460                                int val = 0x007FFFFF & ip.get(u, v); // = mantissa in case of float
461                                if (val != 0) {
462                                        points.add(PntInt.from(u, v));
463                                }
464                        }
465                }
466                return points.toArray(new Pnt2d[0]);
467        }
468        
469        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
470        
471        public static final double DefaultMatchTolerance = 1E-6;
472        
473        /**
474         * Checks if two images have the same type, size and content (using 
475         * {@link #DefaultMatchTolerance}).
476         * 
477         * @param ip1 the first image
478         * @param ip2 the second image
479         * @return true if both images have the same type and content
480         */
481        public static boolean match(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2) {
482                return match(ip1, ip2, DefaultMatchTolerance);
483        }
484        
485        /**
486         * Checks if two images have the same type, size and content (using 
487         * the specified tolerance). 
488         * 
489         * @param ip1 the first image
490         * @param ip2 the second image
491         * @param tolerance the matching tolerance
492         * @return true if both images have the same type, size and content
493         */
494        public static boolean match(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2, double tolerance) {
495                if (!sameType(ip1, ip2)) {
496                        return false;
497                }
498                if (!sameSize(ip1, ip2)) {
499                        return false;
500                }
501                
502                if (ip1 instanceof ByteProcessor) {
503                        byte[] p1 = (byte[]) ip1.getPixels();
504                        byte[] p2 = (byte[]) ip2.getPixels();
505                        return Arrays.equals(p1, p2);
506                }
507                else if (ip1 instanceof ShortProcessor) {
508                        short[] p1 = (short[]) ip1.getPixels();
509                        short[] p2 = (short[]) ip2.getPixels();
510                        return Arrays.equals(p1, p2);
511                }
512                else if (ip1 instanceof ColorProcessor) {
513                        int[] p1 = (int[]) ip1.getPixels();
514                        int[] p2 = (int[]) ip2.getPixels();
515                        return Arrays.equals(p1, p2);
516                }
517                
518                else if (ip1 instanceof FloatProcessor) {
519                        float[] p1 = (float[]) ip1.getPixels();
520                        float[] p2 = (float[]) ip2.getPixels();
521                        boolean same = true;
522                        final float toleranceF = (float) tolerance;
523                        for (int i = 0; i < p1.length; i++) {
524                                if (Math.abs(p1[i] - p2[i]) > toleranceF) {
525                                        same = false;
526                                        break;
527                                }
528                        }
529                        return same;
530                }
531
532                throw new IllegalArgumentException("unknown processor type " + ip1.getClass().getSimpleName());
533        }
534        
535        // BitMap from/to ByteProcessor conversion
536        
537        public static BitMap convertToBitMap(ByteProcessor bp) {
538                return new BitMap(bp.getWidth(), bp.getHeight(), (byte[]) bp.getPixels());
539        }
540
541        public static ByteProcessor convertToByteProcessor(BitMap bitmap) {
542                byte[] pixels = bitmap.getBitVector().toByteArray();
543                return new ByteProcessor(bitmap.getWidth(), bitmap.getHeight(), pixels);
544        }
545        
546        public static void drawPoints(ImageProcessor ip, Pnt2d[] points, int value) {
547                for (int i = 0; i < points.length; i++) {
548                        Pnt2d p = points[i];
549                        if (p != null) {
550                                int u = p.getXint();
551                                int v = p.getYint();
552                                ip.putPixel(u, v, value);
553                        }
554                }
555        }
556        
557        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
558        
559        /**
560         * Runs the given {@link PlugInFilter} instance with empty argument string.
561         * @param pluginfilter an instance of {@link PlugInFilter} 
562         * @return true if no exception was thrown
563         */
564        public static boolean run(PlugInFilter pluginfilter) {
565                return run(pluginfilter, "");
566        }
567        
568        /**
569         * Runs the given {@link PlugInFilter} instance.
570         * @param pluginfilter an instance of {@link PlugInFilter} 
571         * @param arg argument passed to {@link PlugInFilter#setup(String, ImagePlus)}
572         * @return true if no exception was thrown
573         */
574        public static boolean run(PlugInFilter pluginfilter, String arg) {
575                try {
576                        new PlugInFilterRunner(pluginfilter, pluginfilter.getClass().getSimpleName(), arg);
577                } catch (Exception e) {
578                        return false;
579                }
580                return true;
581        }
582        
583        /**
584         * Runs the given {@link PlugIn} instance with empty argument string.
585         * @param plugin an instance of {@link PlugIn}
586         * @return true if no exception was thrown
587         */
588        public static boolean run(PlugIn plugin) {
589                return run(plugin, "");
590        }
591        
592        /**
593         * Runs the given {@link PlugIn} instance.
594         * @param plugin an instance of {@link PlugIn}
595         * @param arg argument passed to {@link PlugIn#run(String)}
596         * @return true if no exception was thrown
597         */
598        public static boolean run(PlugIn plugin, String arg) {
599                try {
600                        plugin.run(arg);
601                } catch (Exception e) {
602                        return false;
603                }
604                return true;
605        }
606        
607        // ------------------------------------------------------------------
608        
609        /**
610         * Run a {@link PlugInFilter} from the associated class with empty argument string.
611         * If the plugin's constructor is available, use method {@link #run(PlugInFilter)} instead.
612         * @param clazz class of the pluginfilter
613         * @return true if no exception was thrown
614         */
615        public static boolean runPlugInFilter(Class<? extends PlugInFilter> clazz) {
616                return runPlugInFilter(clazz, "");
617        }
618        
619        /**
620         * Run a {@link PlugInFilter} from the associated class.
621         * If the plugin's constructor is available, use method {@link #run(PlugInFilter, String)} instead.
622         * @param clazz class of the plugin
623         * @param arg argument string
624         * @return true if no exception was thrown
625         */
626        public static boolean runPlugInFilter(Class<? extends PlugInFilter> clazz, String arg) {
627                PlugInFilter thePlugIn = null;
628                try {
629                        thePlugIn = clazz.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
630                } catch (InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException | IllegalArgumentException
631                                | InvocationTargetException | NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException e) {
632                        throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());     // should never happen
633                }
634                return run(thePlugIn, arg);
635        }
636        
637        /**
638         * Run a {@link PlugIn} from the associated class with empty argument string.
639         * If the plugin's constructor is available, use method {@link #run(PlugIn)} instead.
640         * @param clazz class of the plugin
641         * @return true if no exception was thrown
642         */
643        public static boolean runPlugIn(Class<? extends PlugIn> clazz) {
644                return runPlugIn(clazz, "");
645        }
646        
647        /**
648         * Run a {@link PlugIn} from the associated class.
649         * If the plugin's constructor is available, use method {@link #run(PlugIn, String)} instead.
650         * @param clazz class of the plugin
651         * @param arg argument string
652         * @return true if no exception was thrown
653         */
654        public static boolean runPlugIn(Class<? extends PlugIn> clazz, String arg) {
655                PlugIn thePlugIn = null;
656                try {
657                        thePlugIn = clazz.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
658                } catch (InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException | IllegalArgumentException
659                                | InvocationTargetException | NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException e) {
660                        throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());     // should never happen
661                }
662                return run(thePlugIn, arg);
663        }
664
665}
